meanings.definition: The quality or state of being newsworthy.
meanings.sent1: The newsworthinesses of the event made it a headline in the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The newsworthinesses of the story captured the attention of journalists.
meanings.sent3: The newsworthinesses of the cat sleeping on a tree amused the local news crew.
meanings.sent4: Her newsworthinesses in the small town was like a shining star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The newsworthinesses of the discovery was unforgettable to the community.

meanings.definition: The ability to attract or hold the interest of news media.
meanings.sent1: The newsworthinesses of the press conference drew many reporters.
meanings.sent2: His newsworthinesses as a public figure ensured constant media coverage.
meanings.sent3: The newsworthinesses of the dog wearing sunglasses caught the eye of journalists.
meanings.sent4: The newsworthinesses of the scandal was a magnet for news outlets.
meanings.sent5: Her newsworthinesses in the industry was like a beacon for journalists.
